title: Juventus 'planning triple summer transfer swoop' on Premier League
text:

Juventus manager Maurizio Sarri is reportedly looking to sign three Premier League players when the transfer window opens next summer.

And the former Chelsea boss is said to be preparing to raid his old club for two of his targets, as well as making an offer to Tottenham's Christian Erikson.

Reports in Italy (as cited by the Mail ) suggest that Sarri wants Eriksen to join his ranks, along with Chelsea duo N'golo Kante and Emerson Palmieri.

Eriksen is out of contract at the end of the season, but can open negotiations with other clubs from January.

Juve have been linked with the Dane previously and could continue their recent strategy of signing free agents by persuading Eriksen on a switch to Turin.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

The Serie A giants have adopted a successful policy in recent windows that has seen them attract Emre Can from Liverpool , ex-Arsenal star Aaron Ramsey, and Adrien Rabiot, formerly of PSG.

Despite a host of options in midfield, Sarri wants to add his former player Kante to his side as well, and will look to arrange a transfer next summer.

Sarri also wants full-back Emerson to leave Stamford Bridge and return to his homeland by switching tio the Old Lady.

(Image: Getty Images)

Both players form a key part of Frank Lampard's plans at Chelsea, who would want to keep hold of both players.

Much could depend on whether the Blues are able to qualify for next season's Champions League, while Juve will likely face competition from Man Utd and Real Madrid for Eriksen.

Meanwhile Juve's star striker Cristiano Ronaldo has no plans of retiring before the end of his current contract, according to the club's sporting director Fabio Paratici.

(Image: Getty Images)

When asked whether Ronaldo would be calling time on his career before his deal runs out in 2022, Paratici replied: "Absolutely not."

"Ronaldo is very focused on his goals as well as his own personal objectives as he is the Golden Ball candidate again.

"I do not think he can leave at the end of this season and I doubt he will leave at the end of the next one. At the moment I am sure of one thing, we have a contract."
description: The Serie A giants are preparing their end of season business and have identified three targets
